questions.stem: In the following halogenated organic compounds the one with maximum number of chlorine atoms in its structure is :
questions.explanation: Gammaxene (C6H6Cl6) has 6 chlorine atoms, Chloral (C2HCl3O) has 3 chlorine atoms, Chloropicrin (CCl3NO2) has 3 chlorine atoms, Freon-12 (CCl2F2) has 2 chlorine atoms.
questions.tip_formula: Count chlorine atoms in each compound structure
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Incorrect statement for the use of indicators in acid-base titration is :

options.text: Methyl orange may be used for a weak acid vs weak base titration.
Methyl orange is a suitable indicator for a strong acid vs weak base titration
Phenolphthalein is a suitable indicator for a weak acid vs strong base titration
Phenolphthalein may be used for a strong acid vs strong base titration.

questions.explanation: Methyl orange (pH range 3.2-4.5) cannot be used for weak acid vs weak base titration as there is no sharp pH change at equivalence point. It works well for strong acid vs strong base and strong acid vs weak base titrations.
questions.tip_formula: Methyl orange pH range: 3.2-4.5; Phenolphthalein pH range: 8.3-10.5
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which of the following compounds are not used as disinfectants? (A) Chloroxylenol (B) Bithional (C) Veronal (D) Prontosil (E) Terpineol
questions.explanation: Veronal is a neurological medicine, Prontosil is an antibiotic. Chloroxylenol, Bithional, and Terpineol are disinfectants.
questions.tip_formula: Veronal = barbiturate drug; Prontosil = first sulfa drug antibiotic
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: A hydrocarbon ' X ' with formula $\mathrm{C}_{6} \mathrm{H}_{8}$ uses two moles of $\mathrm{H}_{2}$ on catalytic hydrogenation of its one mole. On ozonolysis, ' $X$ ' yields two moles of methane dicarbaldehyde. The hydrocarbon ' X ' is :
questions.explanation: Cyclohexa-1,4-diene has 2 double bonds (uses 2 moles H₂) and on ozonolysis gives 2 moles of OHC-CHO (methane dicarbaldehyde).
questions.tip_formula: Degree of unsaturation = 3; Double bonds = 2
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Cyclohexylamine when treated with nitrous acid yields (P). On treating (P) with PCC results in (Q). When (Q) is heated with dil. NaOH we get (R) The final product $(\mathrm{R})$ is :
questions.explanation: Cyclohexylamine → (HNO₂) Cyclohexanol → (PCC) Cyclohexanone → (dil. NaOH, heat) Cyclopentylcarbaldehyde via ring contraction.
questions.tip_formula: Primary amine + HNO₂ → alcohol; Alcohol + PCC → aldehyde/ketone
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Given below are two statements: Statement I: Upon heating a borax bead dipped in cupric sulphate in a luminous flame, the colour of the bead becomes green. Statement II : The green colour observed is due to the formation of copper(I) metaborate. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

options.text: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Both Statement I and Statement II are false
Statement I is false but Statement II is true

questions.explanation: In luminous (reducing) flame, borax bead with CuSO₄ gives red opaque color (metallic Cu) or colorless (CuBO₂), not green. Green color appears in non-luminous (oxidizing) flame due to Cu(BO₂)₂.
questions.tip_formula: Oxidizing flame: Cu(BO₂)₂ (blue-green); Reducing flame: Cu (red) or CuBO₂ (colorless)
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Evaluate the following statements for their correctness. (A) The elevation in boiling point temperature of water will be same for 0.1 M NaCl and 0.1 M urea. (B) Azeotropic mixtures boil without change in their composition (C) Osmosis always takes place from hypertonic to hypotonic solution (D) The density of $32 \% \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}$ solution having molarity 4.09 M is approximately $1.26 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mL}^{-1}$ (E) A negatively charged sol is obtained when KI solution is added to silver nitrate solution.
questions.explanation: (A) False - NaCl has i=2, urea has i=1; (B) True - azeotropes have constant composition; (C) False - osmosis occurs from hypotonic to hypertonic; (D) True - calculation verified; (E) False - AgI sol is positively charged when KI added to AgNO₃.
questions.tip_formula: ΔT_b ∝ i × m; M = (w% × 10 × d)/M_w
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Compound $\mathrm{A}, \mathrm{C}_{5} \mathrm{H}_{10} \mathrm{O}_{5}$, given a tetraacetate with $\mathrm{Ac}_{2} \mathrm{O}$ and oxidation of A with $\mathrm{Br}_{2}-\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}$ gives an acid, $\mathrm{C}_{5} \mathrm{H}_{10} \mathrm{O}_{6}$. Reduction of A with HI gives isopentane. The possible structure of A is :
questions.explanation: Compound has 4 -OH groups (forms tetraacetate), aldose sugar (oxidized to acid), gives isopentane on reduction (5C chain). Structure is ribose.
questions.tip_formula: Tetraacetate → 4 OH groups; Br₂-H₂O oxidation → aldose to aldonic acid
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Arrange the following orbitals in decreasing order of energy? (A) $\mathrm{n}=3, \mathrm{l}=0, \mathrm{~m}=0$ (B) $\mathrm{n}=4, \mathrm{l}=0, \mathrm{~m}=0$ (C) $\mathrm{n}=3, \mathrm{l}=1, \mathrm{~m}=0$ (D) $\mathrm{n}=3,1=2, \mathrm{~m}=1$
questions.explanation: Energy order by (n+l) rule: D(3d, n+l=5) > B(4s, n+l=4) > C(3p, n+l=4) > A(3s, n+l=3). For same n+l, higher n has higher energy.
questions.tip_formula: Energy order: (n+l) rule; for same (n+l), higher n has higher energy
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The Lewis acid character of boron tri halides follows the order :
questions.explanation: Lewis acid strength increases as back bonding decreases: BF₃ < BCl₃ < BBr₃ < BI₃ due to decreasing pπ-pπ overlap with boron's empty p-orbital.
questions.tip_formula: Back bonding extent: BF₃ > BCl₃ > BBr₃ > BI₃; Lewis acidity: reverse order
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Match List-I with List-II: List-I: (A) Physisorption, (B) Chemisorption, (C) $\mathrm{N}_{2}(\mathrm{~g})+3 \mathrm{H}_{2}(\mathrm{~g}) \xrightarrow{\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{s})} 2 \mathrm{NH}_{3}(\mathrm{~g})$, (D) Analytical Application of Adsorption; List-II: (I) Single layer adsorption, (II) $20-40 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}$, (III) Chromatography, (IV) Heterogeneous catalysis

options.text: A - II, B - III, C - I, D - IV
A - IV, B - II, C - III, D - I
A - II, B - I, C - IV, D - III

questions.explanation: Physisorption: 20-40 kJ/mol; Chemisorption: single layer; Haber process: heterogeneous catalysis; Chromatography: analytical application of adsorption.
questions.tip_formula: Physisorption: 20-40 kJ/mol, multi-layer; Chemisorption: 80-240 kJ/mol, single layer
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R) Assertion (A) : The first ionization enthalpy of 3d series elements is more than that of group 2 metals Reason (R) : In 3d series of elements successive filling of d-orbitals takes place. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.text: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)

questions.explanation: 3d transition elements have higher IE than group 2 metals due to poor shielding of d-electrons and smaller size. The filling of d-orbitals explains this trend.
questions.tip_formula: IE trend: poor shielding by d-electrons increases effective nuclear charge
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The element playing significant role in neuromuscular function and interneuronal transmission is :
questions.explanation: Calcium ions play crucial role in neuromuscular function, interneuronal transmission, cell membrane integrity, and muscle contraction.
questions.tip_formula: Ca²⁺ ions essential for nerve impulse transmission and muscle contraction
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Given below are two statements : Statement I: $\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{2}$ is used in the synthesis of Cephalosporin Statement II: $\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{2}$ is used for the restoration of aerobic conditions to sewage wastes. In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

options.text: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct
Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct
Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect
Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect

questions.explanation: H₂O₂ is used in pharmaceutical synthesis (cephalosporin) and environmental applications (sewage treatment to restore aerobic conditions).
questions.tip_formula: H₂O₂ applications: bleaching, disinfection, oxidation in synthesis, environmental remediation
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The normal rain water is slightly acidic and its pH value is 5.6 because of which one of the following?
questions.explanation: Normal rainwater pH is 5.6 due to dissolved CO₂ forming carbonic acid: CO₂ + H₂O ⇌ H₂CO₃ ⇌ H⁺ + HCO₃⁻
questions.tip_formula: CO₂ + H₂O ⇌ H₂CO₃; pH ≈ 5.6 for normal rainwater
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: When a hydrocarbon A undergoes complete combustion it requires 11 equivalents of oxygen and produces 4 equivalents of water. What is the molecular formula of A ?
questions.explanation: For CₓHᵧ: x + y/4 = 11 (O₂ used), y/2 = 4 (H₂O produced). Solving: y = 8, x = 9. Formula: C₉H₈
questions.tip_formula: CₓHᵧ + (x + y/4)O₂ → xCO₂ + (y/2)H₂O
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: An organic compound $[\mathrm{A}]\left(\mathrm{C}_{4} \mathrm{H}_{11} \mathrm{~N}\right)$, shows optical activity and gives $\mathrm{N}_{2}$ gas on treatment with $\mathrm{HNO}_{2}$. The compound [A] reacts with $\mathrm{PhSO}_{2} \mathrm{Cl}$ producing a compound which is soluble in KOH . The structure of A is:
questions.explanation: C₄H₁₁N with N₂ evolution (HNO₂) → primary amine; optically active → chiral carbon; Hinsberg test soluble in KOH → primary amine. Structure: 2-methylpropylamine.
questions.tip_formula: Primary amine + HNO₂ → alcohol + N₂; Hinsberg test: primary amine gives soluble sulfonamide
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which one of the following statements is incorrect?

options.text: Boron and Indium can be purified by zone refining method.
Van- Arkel method is used to purify tungsten.
Cast iron is obtained by melting pig iron with scrap iron and coke using hot air blast.
The malleable iron is prepared from cast iron by oxidising impurities in a reverberatory furnace.

questions.explanation: Van Arkel method is used for Ti, Zr, Hf, B purification, not tungsten. Tungsten is purified by other methods.
questions.tip_formula: Van Arkel process: for Ti, Zr, Hf, B; Zone refining: for Si, Ge, Ga, In
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: Which of the following elements have half-filled f-orbitals in their ground state ? (Given : atomic number Sm=62 ; Eu=63 ; Tb=65 ; Gd=64, Pm=61 ) A. Sm B. Eu C. Tb D. Gd E. Pm
questions.explanation: Eu (63): 4f⁷6s²; Gd (64): 4f⁷5d¹6s² - both have half-filled f-orbitals. Others: Sm (4f⁶), Tb (4f⁹), Pm (4f⁵) don't have exactly half-filled f-orbitals.
questions.tip_formula: Half-filled f-orbitals: f⁷ configuration; Eu: [Xe]4f⁷6s²; Gd: [Xe]4f⁷5d¹6s²
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: In Dumas method for the estimation of $\mathrm{N}_{2}$, the sample is heated with copper oxide and the gas evolved is passed over :
questions.explanation: In Dumas method, nitrogen oxides formed are reduced to N₂ by passing over heated copper gauze.
questions.tip_formula: Organic N + CuO → CO₂ + H₂O + N₂ + N-oxides; N-oxides + hot Cu → N₂
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: If the CFSE of $\left[\mathrm{Ti}\left(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\right)_{6}\right]^{3+}$ is $-96.0 \mathrm{~kJ} / \mathrm{mol}$, this complex will absorb maximum at wavelength ______ nm. (nearest integer) Assume Planck's constant $(\mathrm{h})=6.4 \times 10^{-34}$ Js Speed of light $(\mathrm{c})=3.0 \times 10^{8} \mathrm{~m} / \mathrm{s}$ Avogadro's constant $\left(\mathrm{N}_{\mathrm{A}}\right)=6 \times 10^{23} / \mathrm{mol}$
questions.tip_formula: λ = hc/E; E = CFSE/N_A
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of given compounds which are soluble in excess of $\mathrm{NaOH}$ is ______. $\mathrm{Al}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}, \mathrm{SiO}_{2}, \mathrm{P}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{5}, \mathrm{Fe}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}, \mathrm{B}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}, \mathrm{SO}_{2}, \mathrm{BeO}, \mathrm{BaO}, \mathrm{Mn}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{7}$
questions.explanation: Soluble in excess NaOH: Al₂O₃, SiO₂, P₂O₅, B₂O₃, SO₂, BeO (amphoteric oxides). Total 6 compounds.
questions.tip_formula: Amphoteric oxides and acidic oxides dissolve in excess NaOH
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s from the following is ______. A. The value of van der Waals constant 'a' is larger for ammonia than for nitrogen. B. The compression factor Z for ideal gas is always unity. C. The mean free path of gas molecules is inversely proportional to pressure of the gas. D. At Boyle temperature, the value of compression factor $Z$ is always 1 at low pressure.
questions.explanation: A: True (NH₃ has stronger intermolecular forces); B: True (Z=1 for ideal gas); C: True (λ ∝ 1/P); D: True (at Boyle temperature, gas behaves ideally at low pressure). All 4 correct.
questions.tip_formula: van der Waals constant 'a' measures intermolecular forces; Z = PV/RT; λ ∝ 1/P
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of correct statement/s from the following is ______. A. The coagulation power of $\mathrm{Al}^{3+}$ is more than $\mathrm{K}^{+}$. B. Lyophilic sol can be coagulated by adding alcohol. C. The flocculation value of $\mathrm{As}_{2} \mathrm{~S}_{3}$ sol is more for $\mathrm{Na}_{3} \mathrm{PO}_{4}$ than for $\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}$. D. Micelles are macromolecular colloids.
questions.explanation: A: True (higher charge has more coagulation power); B: True (alcohol dehydrates lyophilic sol); C: False (As₂S₃ is negative sol, PO₄³⁻ has higher flocculation value than SO₄²⁻? Actually opposite); D: False (micelles are associated colloids, not macromolecular). Correct: A and B.
questions.tip_formula: Hardy-Schulze rule: coagulation power ∝ charge⁶; Flocculation value ∝ 1/coagulation power
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of given metal/s which can be used as cathode to protect iron from corrosion is ______. $\mathrm{Zn}, \mathrm{Mg}, \mathrm{Sn}, \mathrm{Cu}$
questions.explanation: Zn and Mg (more reactive than Fe) can be used as sacrificial anodes to protect iron. Sn and Cu (less reactive) cannot.
questions.tip_formula: Sacrificial protection: metal with lower reduction potential (more reactive) protects iron
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of given reactions in which $\mathrm{P}_{4}$ acts as reducing agent is ______. A. $\mathrm{P}_{4}+\mathrm{SO}_{2} \rightarrow$ B. $\mathrm{P}_{4}+\mathrm{SOCl}_{2} \rightarrow$ C. $\mathrm{P}_{4}+\mathrm{HNO}_{3} \rightarrow$ D. $\mathrm{P}_{4}+\mathrm{Ag} \rightarrow$
questions.explanation: P₄ acts as reducing agent when oxidized: with SOCl₂ (to PCl₃) and with Ag (to Ag₃P). With SO₂ and HNO₃, P₄ acts as oxidizing agent.
questions.tip_formula: Reducing agent gets oxidized; P₄ oxidation state changes from 0 to positive
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of given compounds which give colour in Lassaigne's test for nitrogen is ______. Hydrazine, Urea, Aniline, Nitrobenzene, Azobenzene, Hydrazoic acid
questions.explanation: Compounds giving positive Lassaigne's test: Hydrazine, Urea, Aniline, Azobenzene (all have nitrogen that forms NaCN on fusion). Nitrobenzene and Hydrazoic acid may not give reliable test.
questions.tip_formula: Lassaigne's test: organic N + Na → NaCN; NaCN + Fe²⁺ → [Fe(CN)₆]⁴⁻; + Fe³⁺ → Prussian blue
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of given compounds which can show tautomerism is ______. Acetyl acetone, 2-Pentanone, Cyclohexane-1, 3-dione, Diethyl malonate, Acetoacetic ester, Phenol
questions.explanation: Compounds showing tautomerism: Acetyl acetone, Cyclohexane-1,3-dione, Diethyl malonate, Acetoacetic ester (all β-dicarbonyls with active methylene). 2-Pentanone (simple ketone) and Phenol don't show significant tautomerism.
questions.tip_formula: Keto-enol tautomerism favored in β-dicarbonyl compounds due to conjugation and intramolecular H-bonding
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of given compounds which can give positive Tollen's test is ______. Glucose, Fructose, Sucrose, Maltose, Galactose, Lactose
questions.explanation: Tollen's test positive for reducing sugars: Glucose, Fructose, Maltose, Lactose, Galactose. Sucrose is non-reducing.
questions.tip_formula: Tollen's test: for aldehydes and α-hydroxyketones; detects reducing sugars
questions.subject: Chemistry

questions.stem: The number of given species in which the central atom uses $\mathrm{sp}^{3}$ hybrid orbitals in its bonding is ______. $\mathrm{XeO}_{3}, \mathrm{XeO}_{4}, \mathrm{XeO}_{2} \mathrm{~F}_{2}, \mathrm{XeOF}_{4}, \mathrm{XeF}_{4}$
questions.explanation: sp³ hybridization: XeO₃ (pyramidal), XeO₄ (tetrahedral). Others: XeO₂F₂ (see-saw, sp³d), XeOF₄ (square pyramidal, sp³d²), XeF₄ (square planar, sp³d²).
questions.tip_formula: Steric number = 4 → sp³; Steric number = 5 → sp³d; Steric number = 6 → sp³d²
questions.subject: Chemistry
